meanings.definition: The state of being close in distance or proximity.
meanings.sent1: The closeness of the two houses made it easy for the neighbors to chat over the fence.
meanings.sent2: I felt the closeness of the person standing next to me in the crowded elevator.
meanings.sent3: The closeness of the siblings was evident in the way they finished each other's sentences.
meanings.sent4: The closeness of the relationship between the two countries was reflected in their shared history and culture.
meanings.sent5: The closeness of the stars in the night sky created a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: The quality of being intimate or emotionally connected.
meanings.sent1: The closeness between the best friends was evident in the way they shared their deepest secrets.
meanings.sent2: I treasure the closeness I feel with my family during our Sunday dinners together.
meanings.sent3: The closeness of the bond between the dog and its owner was heartwarming to witness.
meanings.sent4: The closeness of the friendship between the two classmates was like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The closeness of the characters in the book made me feel like I was part of their world.

meanings.definition: The degree of accuracy or precision in a measurement or calculation.
meanings.sent1: The closeness of the scientist's measurements allowed for a more reliable experiment.
meanings.sent2: The closeness of the carpenter's cuts ensured a perfect fit for the furniture pieces.
meanings.sent3: The closeness of the estimate to the actual cost saved the project from going over budget.
meanings.sent4: The closeness of the map to the actual terrain helped the hikers navigate the trail easily.
meanings.sent5: The closeness of the student's answer to the correct solution impressed the teacher.
